Description: Diptych; ivory; mounted in a frame with glass front and back; traces of Greek lettering in ink on both panels; nail holes and the remains of two copper alloy fastenings on the edges.
Curator's comments: New edition in preparation by E. R. O'Connell [2017] See: W.E. Crum, "A Greek diptych of the seventh century", Proceedings of the Society of Biblical Archaeology 30 (1908) pp. 255-65; ibid., "The Bishops named in Mr Bryces Diptych", PSBA 31 (1909), p. 288; Exh. cat. Agypten, Schatze aus dem Wustensand...Gustave-Lubecke-Museum Hamm 16 Juni - 13 Oktober 1996 (Weisbaden, 1996), no. 287, p. 259.
Bibliographic references: Effenberger and von Falck 1996 / Ägypten, Schätze aus dem Wüstensand: Kunst und Kultur der Christen am Nil (no.287, p.259)
Paris 2000 / L'art copte en Égypte 2000 ans de christianisme: Exposition présentée à l’Institut du monde arabe, Paris (no.13, p.44)
Fluck et al. 2015 / Egypt: Faith after the Pharaohs (100)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2015, Oct 29 – 2016, Feb 7. British Museum, Room 35. Egypt: Faith after the Pharoahs 2010 26 Feb-13 Jun, Germany, Bonn, Kunst and Ausstellungshalle der Bundesrepublik Deutschland, Byzantium: Splendour and Daily Life 2000 30 Sep-2001 7 Jan, France, La Clape, Musée de l’Ephebe, L’art copte en Egyptee 2000 15 May-3 Sep, France, Paris, Institut du Monde Arabe, Coptic Art 1997 20 Mar-13 Jul, Germany, Munich, Staatliche Sammlung Agyptischer Kunst, Agypten: Schätze aus dem Wüstensand - Kunst und Kultur der Christen am Nil 1996 24 Nov-1997 23 Feb, Germany, Mainz, Landesmuseum Mainz, Agypten - Schatze aus dem Wustensand: Kunst und Kultur der Christen am Nil 1996 15 Jun-13 Oct, Germany, Hamm, Gustav Lübcke Museum, Agypten: Schatze aus dem Wustensand - Kunst und Kultur der Christem am Nil
Associated names: Named in inscription: Agathon, Bishop of Alexandria
Named in inscription: Pesyntheos, Bishop of Hermonthis
Acquisition notes: Once in the possession of Mr. M. Moir Bryce, of Edinburgh, who bought it at Luxor in 1903.
